item.title: Indonesia bans palm oil exports
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It’s one of the most extreme examples yet of how the war in Ukraine is rattling global supply chains and stoking concerns of food shortages, thousands of miles away from the fighting. Unilever, which uses palm oil in products like Dove soap and Hellmann’s mayonnaise, warned investors it may need to jack up prices in the second half of this year. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeToday marks the beginning of a ban on palm oil exports from Indonesia, which accounts for one-third of the world’s edible oil supply. —JW Indonesia’s ban could send vegetable oil prices spiraling upwards. After prices spiked, the Indonesian government decided to lock down its palm oil supply to ensure its own population doesn’t experience shortages. We have bad news: Palm oil is the most common cooking oil globally.

item.title: Meta returned to user growth last quarter, shares pop
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. At one point, it was worth more than Disney; now, it’s not even half as valuable. As it shifts its focus to virtual worlds, Meta increased revenue just 7% last quarter, its slowest sales growth in its 10 years as a public company. After a gain of 4.8% yesterday, its stock is only down ~15% for the year, which, while not…good, is a better performance than every FAANG company outside of Apple. Shares popped more than 18% after hours when the company revealed that it returned to user growth last quarter. —NF

item.title: Harvard seeks to redress its historical ties to slavery with $100 million fund
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. —MK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The report revealed that Harvard directly profited from slavery for centuries as it became America’s preeminent university. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeFollowing a substantial report detailing its historical ties to slavery, segregation, and discrimination, Harvard University announced yesterday that it will commit $100 million to further study and redress those ties. The report’s authors—a committee of Harvard faculty members—made a series of recommendations to work as a foundation to redress the institution’s legacy. Among its other findings:More than 70 Black and Native American people were enslaved by Harvard faculty and staff between 1636 and 1783. Rather than direct financial reparations to the descendants of enslaved people, the report recommends the fund be used to improve educational opportunities for descendants, establish relationships with Black colleges and universities, and honor enslaved people through memorials, curriculum, and research.

item.title: Delta Air Lines will pay flight attendants during boarding
item.description: . The trading app is letting about 9% of its full-time employees go, saying that its hiring spree last year led to “duplicate roles and job functions.” Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. At least 58% of the US population had antibodies from a previous Covid-19 infection in February, up from 34% in December, according to new data from the CDC. The company announced it’ll begin paying flight attendants during boarding time. What happened in between? css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}Subscribe✈️ Boarding just got more pleasant for Delta flight attendants. The Association of Flight Attendants, a union that has been attempting to organize Delta employees, said, “This new policy is the direct result of our organizing.” It’s a first for a major US airline (typically, flight attendant pay begins when the plane’s door closes and passengers are seated).

item.title: More fallout from Elon Musk’s purchase of Twitter
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Investors might be spooked that even the seemingly superhuman Musk could lose focus while trying to overhaul Twitter, or that he would have to sell his Tesla shares to help pay for the deal. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeStill nursing a hangover from Twitter accepting Elon Musk’s buyout offer? Musk’s pledge to allow unfettered speech on Twitter was celebrated by Republicans, who seemingly began to flock to the platform following the deal’s announcement. Alternatively, Twitter would owe Musk $1 billion if shareholders ultimately reject the offer or if it finds a more attractive buyer. Shares of the EV company helmed by Musk fell more than 12% yesterday, erasing more than $125 billion in market value. Time to make up, boys? css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Ask the audience: Do you think Twitter’s product will improve, get worse, or mostly remain the same under Musk’s ownership? There is a breakup fee: According to a new SEC filing, Musk would potentially owe Twitter $1 billion if his financing sources fall through. Musk’s archrival on Earth and in space wondered, given the importance of the Chinese market to Tesla’s business, “Did the Chinese government just gain a bit of leverage over the town square?” It also means that Musk lost $21 billion on paper yesterday, which is the same amount he has personally committed to the Twitter purchase.

item.title: GM officially announced an electrified Corvette
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Let’s see that executive order first, Joe.The new ‘Vette will join the growing list of notorious, engine-revving, sleeveless-shirt-wearing-macho-dude vehicles being electrified. —MM css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! GM President Mark Reuss said that Chevy will sell an “electrified” (AKA hybrid, probably) Corvette next year, and eventually make it all-electric. GM said last June it would invest $35 billion through 2025 to boost EV- and autonomous vehicle (AV) tech, including spending $7 billion to build a Michigan battery plant and update other factories in the state for EV production. Last August, President Biden even joked during a speech, “When they make the first electric Corvette, I get to drive it.” Last July, Dodge said it would release an EV muscle car in 2024. There’s been a lot of anticipation for the iconic sports car’s non-gas version since GM said in January 2021 it would commit to exclusively selling EVs by 2035. Zoom out: Legacy automakers are betting it all on an electric future. And Ford slapped the Mustang name on its first electric SUV in 2019.

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. People in the “everyone is overreacting” camp say that Elon’s Twitter will be a series of marginal tweaks and endless compromises that may not move the needle one way or the other. With Twitter treading water, some tech analysts, such as Stratechery’s Ben Thompson, say that Musk—who has a history of creating really valuable companies—could unlock Twitter’s potential by better monetizing Twitter’s influential user base consisting of leaders in tech, media, and finance. Further reading: 1) Everything Elon Musk said he wants to change about Twitter and 2) a grand theory of what Elon’s up to with Twitter.
